title: Calories in 4 oz Salmon
meta_description: Discover calories in 4 oz salmon, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per 100 g basis, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Atlantic salmon, farmed, cooked (baked or grilled), skinless, no added oil or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by salmon type (wild vs. farmed), cut, cooking method, and portion size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 4 oz cooked salmon provides ~234 kcal and ~25 g protein.

label_note: Totals are scaled from the per-100 g basis and mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil for cooking per 100 g
Wild salmon (leaner than farmed) per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 4 oz cooked salmon?
faqs.a: About 234 kcal for 4 oz baked or grilled salmon.

faqs.q: What's the protein in 4 oz salmon?
faqs.a: Roughly 25 g protein, making it a great lean source.
No carbs, 0 g fiber or sugars in plain cooked salmon.
Wild is lower (~166 kcal per 100 g) due to less fat than farmed (~206 kcal per 100 g).

faqs.q: How does cooking affect salmon nutrition?
faqs.a: Baking or grilling keeps calories similar; frying with oil adds 40+ kcal per tsp.
